Description: Body fragment of Attic black-figured pottery lekythos. Parts of three satyrs moving right; merely a leg of the leftmost one, the legs and tail of the central one, and the tail of the right. Line below, above part of chequer frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 81 no. 272 pl. 61)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1922)
